snippet: “The Best of Enemies,” at the George Street Playhouse, recounts the unlikely friendship between Claiborne Paul Ellis, a Klansman, and Ann Atwater, a civil rights activist.
abstract: Anita Gates reviews George Street Playhouse production of Mark St Germain play The Best of Enemies, directed by Julianne Boyd and starring John Bedford Lloyd and Aisha Hinds; play is based on book by Osha Gray Davidson (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: “The Best of Enemies,” at the George Street Playhouse, recounts the unlikely friendship between Claiborne Paul Ellis, a Klansman, and Ann Atwater, a civil rights activist.
